entry.title: Behaviour in SAP Cloud ALM Test Execution Analytics
entry.content:
When going to the Analytics section of the Test Execution there is always also a Line Item "None".
What I don´t understand it show 132 test cases that are not assigned to a test plan.
All test cases have been assigned to different test plans and the total amount of testcases is way above that number.
So what exactly does it show here?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Behaviour in SAP Cloud ALM Test Execution Analytics
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

In the Test Execution Analysis app, it displays the result for the Test Executions, but not the Test Cases.

As documented in the guide Test Execution Concepts:
Each instance of the test case (called an occurrence) corresponds to a specific test plan.
In addition, an extra occurrence per test case is also always available in the test plan group (None). 

It is an expected behavior that the test execution under Test Plan (None) is included in the Test Execution Analysis report.
You may use the filter 'Test Plan' to filter out the 'None' from the result in case needed. Please refer to the following KBA:

3554602 - Test cases appear in 'Test plan (None)' in Test Execution app 

Best regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: Re: Change user WO resp not possible batch wise anymore
entry.content:
Hi,

What app are you using for the mass person responsible change in S/4HANA Public Cloud?

I have just tested this with the 'Manage Maintenance Notifications and Orders' app, and mass edit works as expected. If yours doesn't, you may need to create a support ticket with some replication instructions.

Also, yes the default behaviour is that the update won't be allowed from a TECO status onwards. You should get an error message of "Status of order XXX does not allow changes".

I would recommend creating a customer influence request via the influence portal, then checking to see if other companies want this: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, Asset Management 

There might also be other ways of handling it such as trying to tap into a 'team' via the invoice workflow instead of referencing a person responsible in the work order. You might need to activate some custom logic/BADi to do so, just depends on how much of a pain point this is / the frequency that this is happening: How to Configure the Flexible Workflow for Supplier Invoices 

Tim

entry.title: Re: How to Define Posting Rules-Period Selection field？
entry.content: The configuration must be consistent. Both the posting rule's Period Selection and its parent Rule Group's Processing Mode must be set to YTD for the final posted result to be correct.

Origin table

entry.title: Re: DataTable value not refreshing in SAP MDK
entry.content:
Add ClearData OnLoad Property

{
"_Type": "Section.Type.DataTable",
"Target": "/Application/Rules/ReturnData.js",
"DataPaging": {
"ShowLoadingIndicator": true,
"PageSize": 30
},
"_Name": "SectionDataTable0",
"ClearDataOnLoad": true, // Add this property
// ... rest of the configuration
}

entry.title: Re: Achieving Sustainability With SAP Asset Performance Management By Leveraging Industrial Systems.
entry.content:
Effective Data Management with PiLog DQG Suite 

Managing vast amounts of data across complex asset ecosystems can be a huge challenge for businesses today. PiLog Data Quality and Governance (DQG) Suite provides an alternative that is transformational in the nature that it rationalizes, standardizes, and automates data management. This suite is designed to assist the companies have an efficient control of their enterprise data, that is, convert it into a productive asset and not a failure.  

Why PiLog DQG Suite? 

The PiLog DQG Suite is a comprehensive framework that actively integrates AI-driven automation, industry-specific content and standards, and powerful governance protocols. This powerful combination ensures data integrity and operational excellence. 

 

 

Core Components of the Suite 

  • Autonomous AI Agents Framework: Smart automation that accelerates data transformation. 
  • iContent Foundry: A rich repository of 25 million Records with ISO standards and industry-specific content. 
  • Master Data Governance: Covers Assets, Spares, Services, Vendors, and Articles. 
  • Data Quality & Migration: Seamless migration from legacy systems (ECC, P6, IBM) to SAP S/4HANA (On-Premises, Public, and Private cloud). 

Industry-Relevant Asset Types 

From drills and boilers to railroad analysers and power grids, PiLog supports a wide range of Asset Types across sectors like: 

  • Mill Products 
  • Mining & Metals 
  • Chemicals 
  • Construction 
  • Petro-Chemicals 
  • Utilities 
  • Travel & Transportation 
  • Energy & Natural Resources 
  • Pharmaceuticals 
  • Public Sector 

Maturity Assessment & Roadmap 

PiLog  guides organizations through a structured Data Maturity journey: 

                       

 

 

Manual → Digitized → Standardized → Optimized → Autonomous 

  • Manual → Data handled through spreadsheets and ad-hoc processes. 
  • Digitized → Information moved into digital systems but still fragmented. 
  • Standardized → Unified formats and taxonomies bring consistency across data. 
  • Optimized → Data is governed, high-quality, and actively driving efficiency. 
  • Autonomous → AI and automation enable self-correcting, self-managing data. 

This roadmap ensures that enterprises evolve their data practices in alignment with business goals and technological advancements. 

Data Transformation Process 

The suite follows a clear and effective transformation pipeline: 

 

 

Acquisition → Cleansing & Classification → Governance & AI Agents → Replication to S/4 & SCM 

  • Acquisition → Capturing data from diverse sources. 
  • Cleansing & Classification → Removing errors and structuring with standard taxonomies. 
  • Governance & AI Agents → Enforcing rules and enabling intelligent data management. 
  • Replication to S/4 & SCM → Delivering trusted, ready-to-use data into SAP systems. 

This ensures that data is not only clean and standardized but also ready for real-time operational use. 

Master & Meta Data Content 

PiLog provides a comprehensive repository including: 

 

 

  • Standards → PiLog's repository is built on established rules and guidelines that define the format and quality of the data. 
  • Taxonomy → PiLog's content is organized using a hierarchical classification system for streamlined data management. 
  • OEM, OCM, OPM → The repository includes vital data related to Original Equipment, Component, and Part Manufacturers. 
  • Repository → PiLog provides a centralized location for storing and managing all master and metadata. 
  • Ready Reference → All data within the PiLog repository is pre-validated and readily available for immediate use and reference. 

Supported Master Data Objects 

The suite manages a wide array of master data objects such as: 

  • Asset Equipment → Centralized records for assets throughout their lifecycle. 
  • Functional Location → Hierarchical mapping of where assets belong in operations. 
  • Work Center → Defining the people, machines, and resources that perform tasks. 
  • BoMs (Bills of Materials) → Structured details of components that make up equipment. 
  • Maintenance Strategy & Plans → Standardized schedules and rules for asset upkeep. 
  • MRO Material & Services → Streamlined data for spare parts, consumables, and vendor services. 
  • Failure Mode Library → Catalog of potential failure scenarios to support reliability analysis. 
  • MP Industrial System Objects → Representation of complex industrial systems in line with IEC/ISO standards. 

Seamless Integration 

With compatibility across SAP API HUB and SAP Cloud ERP, PiLog ensures smooth integration into existing enterprise ecosystems. 

Transform Your Data, Transform Your Business 

Either mining, utilities or manufacturing, the PiLog DQG Suite has a scalable, driven, and transformation-ready data management approach. Being built on AI agents and industry specific content, it is finally high time to pull the lever towards autonomous excellence rather than a manual mechanism.

entry.title: SAP Field Service management crew functionality basic setup and learnings
entry.content:
INTRODUCTION:

This blog explores how Crew Management empowers dispatchers and technicians to deliver smarter, faster, and safer service through structured team execution. 

  • Inefficient task allocation leading to delays and resource mismanagement
  • Limited scalability to handle high volumes of service requests
  • Inconsistent skill matching affecting the quality of specialized tasks

To overcome operational inefficiencies we used this solution for executing the field teams operations which helped in Structured crew creation with designated leads and members for better accountability, Skill-based task assignment aligned with technician availability and expertise, Real-time schedule monitoring and adjustments improving responsiveness which helps the Dispatchers.

Getting Started: Prerequisites for SAP FSM Crew Management

To successfully enable and utilize the Crew Management feature in SAP Field Service Management, certain foundational elements must be in place:

  • Admin User Access: Required to configure crew settings, manage permissions, and control access across the system.
  • Service Technicians: Must be created with relevant skill profiles and assigned to appropriate regions to ensure accurate crew composition.
  • Dispatchers: Play a key role in planning, scheduling, and assigning tasks to crews based on availability and expertise.

Additionally, all essential master data including regions, customers, equipment, and service call types must be properly configured and aligned. This ensures smooth crew operations, accurate task assignments, and compliance with service protocols.

Enable Crew Functionality

  • Navigate to Settings and Configuration in SAP FSM.
  • Go to Planning and Dispatching.
  • Enable the Crew Management feature.

Create and Manage Crews

  • Use the Master Data Management (MDM) application to create crews.
  • Define crew leads and members.
  • Assign relevant skills and availability to each crew member.

Assign crew technicians for required dates: 1 lead & 1 member added for this case.

Assign Crews to Activities

  • In the Planning and Dispatching application:
    • Assign service calls or activities directly to crews.
    • Ensure that crew schedules align with appointment times.
  • A service call is created along with an activity, which is then assigned to a crew for execution.

Monitor and Adjust Crew Schedules

  • Use the Crew Planning View to:
    • Track crew availability.
    • Adjust crew composition and member roles as needed.
    • Monitor real-time progress and reassign tasks dynamically.

Setting up the view to display only crew, which will hide individual technicians:


Note: The customer, crew names and all the master data shown in the screenshots are for illustrative purposes only.

Implementation Highlights

The SAP FSM Crew Management helped dispatchers to restructure the technicians in field service operations. Crews were strategically formed based on task complexity and required skill sets, ensuring the right expertise was deployed for each job. Dispatchers used FSM’s intuitive interface to dynamically allocate resources, monitor progress in real time, and respond swiftly to changing service demands.

Results Achieved

The implementation delivered measurable improvements across key performance areas: increase in task completion rate driven by better crew coordination and thanks to optimized scheduling and resource utilization allowing us to dynamically change the technicians based on the schedule and requirements, this also Improved efficiency through team-based protocols and structured execution and also Enhanced collaboration and skill development within crews sharing knowledge on the job.

Lessons Learned

  • Crew-based execution significantly boosts efficiency and service quality in field operations.
  • Real-time visibility into crew schedules is essential for managing dynamic workloads.
  • Crew Management in SAP Field Service Management (FSM) operates as a standalone planning and dispatching solution. It is not integrated with backend systems like SAP S/4HANA via the PACG connector, which currently supports only the legacy “Teams” functionality. As a result, all crew-related planning, scheduling, and execution must be managed exclusively within the FSM environment.

Conclusion

SAP FSM Crew Management proved to be a transformative solution for the utility company, enabling scalable field operations, improving service delivery, and reinforcing safety and efficiency. By aligning the right people with the right tasks at the right time, the company unlocked new levels of performance and agility in its service processes.

Importantly, SAP continues to invest in enhancing the Crew Management functionality, aiming to deliver greater value for both customers and FSM users. Future updates are expected to expand integration capabilities, improve usability, and support more advanced planning scenarios making Crew Management an even more powerful tool for field service excellence.  Updates for the same can be tracked in the official website (requires login) link with filter for crew: https://roadmaps.sap.com/board?CB=6EAE8B28C5D91ED8B4D1529625C9C0D2&q=crew&range=FIRST-LAST

 

 

Thanks

Best Regards,

Dhanush

entry.title: gCTS - Backup and Restore specific ABAP Object - Git
entry.content:
Using gCTS, the objects are backed up to the GitHub Repository.  If a specific object needs to be restored from Git to On-Premises System, there is no option for it in gCTS. 

It is possible to Push to Git Repository by TR/Package/Object specific. To restore, only 'Current Commit' and 'Last Repository Action' is available in gCTS. 

Purpose of restoring specific objects: If a specific Git Repo is used as backup option to Retire some ABAP Objects, in some case, the retired/deleted object specific to RICEFW may need to be restored. At that point, other Retired ABAP Objects is not needed for Restore. Only Selected-Specific objects needs to be Pulled to SAP System. 

How will I retore specific object? Any alternate way?

entry.title: Data Migration - Bulgaria EUR Transition for S/4HANA Cloud Public Cloud Live Customers
entry.content:
This is only relevant for Partners and Live Customers who are required to transit Production system data with EUR adoption in Bulgaria. How To Guide Collection - Bulgaria EUR Transition for S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Live Customers

In the 4th session offered by ASC Cloud ERP Expertise Services, the main topic covered is around Data Migration.

  • Recording - Bulgaria EUR Transition for Live Customers (Data Migration)
  • Presentation - Bulgaria EUR Transition for Live Customers (Data Migration)
  • Accelerator Guide - Bulgaria EUR Transition for Live Customers (Data Migration)

Key Discussion Points‌

‌1. Data Migration Strategy‌

  • Focus on currency conversion from BGN to EUR for impacted customers
  • Requires creation of new company code with EUR as local currency
  • Migration of relevant customer data to new company code

2.    Migration Process Overview‌

  • Follows SAP Activate methodology phases:
  • Explore: Data migration strategy and requirements alignment
  • Realize: Data migration development and staging table preparation
  • Deploy: Cutover activities and go-live

‌3. Technical Approach‌

  • Uses S/4HANA Migration Cockpit as primary tool
  • No automation available for public cloud (unlike private cloud)
  • Requires manual extraction → transformation → loading process
  • Supports over 200 standard migration objects

‌4. Critical Considerations‌

  • Close open transactional items pre-migration to minimize effort
  • Review master data and use mass maintenance apps where possible
  • Handle currency conversion for amount fields during transformation

5. Next Step

  • Review accelerator documents for object-specific migration guidance
  • Validate approach through development system testing
  • Schedule migrations during low-activity periods to minimize system impact

Live Questions & Answers

‌Topic Area‌

‌Question‌

‌Answer‌

Employee

What about Employee Work Agreement? We use Business Partner data for expense payment and these needs to be switched to new CC as well. We load them via Interface from an external Tool (Workday)

Then it would be required to update the newly migrated cost centres and company codes in the external system and updating the worker in S/4HANA public cloud. This can not be covered via the data migration cockpit.  

History inventory movement

Would it be possible to migrate history inventory movements per material?

It is only possible to migrate the inventory balance, financial inventory balance as well as physical stock level, no movement history per material - Material inventory balance

GRIR Account Migration

How to handle historical goods receipts when invoices will be posted in new company code?

GR/IR (goods receipt / invoice receipt) accounts need to already be balanced by the migration key date (posting date). The MM - Purchase order (only open PO) migration object supports only open purchase orders, that is, items that haven't been delivered and invoiced yet. This means that there are no open items on the GR/IR clearing accounts at this point in time.

 

Down Payments

How to settle down payments against open POs in new company code?

When migrating the down payments made to suppliers first step is to replicate the payment request in the target company code using the app “Manage Supplier Down Payment Requests” (F1688). Once they got replicated, next step is to clear them by using the app “Clear outgoing Payments” (F1367) against previously migrated accounts payable open items which should have been booked onto your AP migration offsetting account during the account payables open item migration process.

Others

Do you have similar guide for the EUR transition for ECC system and specially for IS-U system?

Unfortunately, we only focus on Public Cloud ERP. 

Here is what we known that has been published. (Contacts (mail) and way to proceed is documented)

·      Main note: 3196150 - Collective note for Euro changeover in Bulgaria - SAP for Me

·      If ERP system 316222 - Local currency changeover to target currency with SAP ERP Systems (ECC) - SAP for Me

·      If S/4 PCE/OP 3229024 - S/4HANA Currency Changeover - Central Note - SAP for Me

Additionally, our Globalization Services team also has available collaborative Workzone group for Bulgaria https://pages.community.sap.com/topics/localization/regional-collaboration

Please select the EUR Bulgaria and register. Approvals will be done by Globalization Services and usually soon.

This channel is often used by ECC/OP/PCE customers.

Call-to-Action

Register and Attend Upcoming Webinar presented by SAP Service experts with practical suggestions

  • Register Now [Sept 3rd] Bulgaria EUR Transition for Live Customers (Finance)
  • RegisterNow [Sept 24th] Bulgaria EUR Transition for Live Customers (Sales, Reporting, Q&A)
  • [Replay] Overview, IAM, Cutover Plan -Bulgaria EUR Transition for S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Live ...  
  • [Replay] Integration & Extensibility - Bulgaria EUR Transition for S/4HANA Cloud Public Cloud Live Customers
  • [Replay] Sourcing & Procurement - Bulgaria EUR Transition for S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Live Customers

Please view all content and raise questions with tag #Bulgaria

entry.title: Introducing the Devtoberfest Scavenger Hunt 🔨🪙 ... COMING SOON
entry.content:
Welcome to the Devtoberfest Scavenger Hunt, a chase around important SAP developer-related tools/sites, a challenge to construct a secret phrase, and a chance to win 1000s of points toward the Devtoberfest grand prize.

The hunt officially starts Sept. 25, with the release of the first clue during that day's SAP Developer News, and you have until the end of Devtoberfest, Oct. 24, to complete it.

To get all the clues make sure to SUBSCRIBE TO THIS POST!!

Learn more about the  entire Devtoberfest event in @KevinR's post Devtoberfest 2025 Welcome!.

What you need to find

We have hidden a special phrase, which you need to figure out using the clues in the next section. Along your journey you will do the following:

  1. Visit about 10 different locations related to SAP developers, mostly web sites that are designed to help you in your daily SAP development.
  2. At each location, you will discover a set of hexadecimal digits.
  3. Concatenate the digits together (in the order of the missions) to get one, 37-digit hexadecimal number.
  4. Multiply that hexadecimal number by another secret number, for which we will give a clue.
  5. Take the resulting 38-digit hexadecimal product, and convert it into the secret phrase, using each pair of digits as ASCII characters.
  6. Enter the phrase, exactly (case-sensitive, no extra spaces), into the Scavenger Hunt tutorial.‌

Not until the SAP Developer News of Oct. 16 will you have all the pieces to be able to complete the phrase. 

Example Mission

As an example of what you will have to do, here's a short sample mission (just a warm-up, no points will be earned).

MissionNo. DigitsSAP Web PropertyInstructions
17

SAP Developers YouTube Channel

Go to our SAP Developer YouTube channel. 

Open @Rekha_DR's video "SAP Build Process Automation (Part 1): Build your very first process". Watch it and find the secret 7-digit hexadecimal number in one of the info cards.

26SAP Community

Use the Developer Tools on your browser to inspect the words "SAP Community" in the previous column and find the 6-digit ASCII code for the color of the text.

 

3None (directly) 

Concatenate the 2 sets of hexadecimal digits, in order, and multiply the resulting hexadecimal number by the number of original SAP founders (you can easily find the number on the SAP Wikipedia page).

Convert the resulting hexadecimal number into a phrase, converting each pair of digits into a character using ASCII codes.

👉Post a comment/picture about the phrase -- but NOT the phrase itself  (like your experiences with or opinion about the phrase, or a picture of something belonging to you that reminds you of the phrase) -- you won't get any points, but it will be fun and you will be ready for the real scavenger hunt. If you have any trouble with this example mission, post in the comments.

REMINDER: The above is just an example of how the real scavenger hunt will work. The real scavenger hunt instructions will be described in the rest of this blog post, as clues become available.

 

The (real) mission

Below are the instructions for finding the hexadecimal digits for the actual scavenger hunt. We will release clues as follows:

  • In the SAP Developer News of Sept. 25, Oct. 2, Oct. 9, and Oct. 16.
  • In this blog each Monday during the first 3 weeks of Devtoberfest.

👉To be notified when a new clue is released, SUBSCRIBE TO THIS POST!!

‌ When you find the secret phase, just enter it into this Devtoberfest tutorial.

To guide you, we have created a second tutorial -- you do not have to use it, nor do you get any points from it. But you can enter the 1 to 6 digits from each mission to check if you received the correct digits for that mission.

Here are your missions:

 

MissionNo. DigitsSAP Web PropertyInstructions

All delivered by some of your favorite Developer Advocates, like DJ, Shilpa Shankar, Thomas Jung, Antonio Maradiaga, Nora von Thenen and the rest of the gang.

entry.title: Re: how to create a workflow for the diary ledger
entry.content:
Hi @yahaha 

in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, approval workflows for journal entries are supported through flexible workflow.

  1. Here is the App you can use
  • Use the Manage Workflows for Journal Entry Verification app. This app lets you define approval workflows for parked journal entries before they are posted.
  1. The following steps will guide you on how you can set it up
  1. Activating the desired Workflow
    • Open Manage Your Solution or CBC.
    • Scope item 1GA – J59 which is the Journal Entry Verification must be activated.
  2. Configuring the desired Workflow
    • Go to Manage Workflows for Journal Entry Verification app.
    • Create a new workflow scenario. Then define the following:
      • Start conditions for example company code, document type, amount. Then define the Step sequence. Thereafter, the approver determination for example role, user, organizational unit must be defined.
  3. You can carry out Testing as follows
    • Post a journal entry via Post General Journal Entries app but select Park. The entry will trigger the workflow. Then approvers will receive tasks in My Inbox app where they can approve or reject.
  4. Once approval is completed, the system will automatically post the journal entry.

References:

Journal Entry Verification Workflow

Manage Workflows for Journal Entry Verification

I hope this provides the right guidance. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: ATP vs Advanced ATP in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private edition 2023
entry.content:
Introduction

Choosing between ATP and Advanced ATP is a crucial decision for organizations seeking future-proof functionality. This guide outlines the key considerations for making the right choice and clarifies the limitations and future roadmap of each platform.

Understanding the Platforms

  • ATP (Advanced To Promise): ATP has served as a robust tool for threat detection and response. However, it is important to note that ATP will not be enhanced with new features going forward. Its existing capabilities will be maintained, but no future innovation.
  • Advanced ATP: Advanced ATP is designed with expanded functionality, incorporating more sophisticated threat analytics and response mechanisms. It benefits from ongoing development and regular introduction of new features to address emerging business challenges.

Key Differences

  • Feature Development: ATP will not receive additional features, while Advanced ATP will continue to evolve with new capabilities.
  • Integration: It is not possible to combine ATP and Advanced ATP functionalities. Each platform operates independently, and use of features from one cannot be merged with the other.

Advanced ATP functionalities

Product Availability Check (PAC)

  • It is possible to configure detailed verification scopes based on specific requirements or quantities.
  • Correlation of Schedule Line quantities in Sales Bill of Material
  • Zero Confirmation or full confirmation at End of Replenishment Lead Time by the configuration

Back Order Processing (BOP)

  • Configuration also enables the extension of prioritization capabilities, allowing users to tailor priority rules according to specific business requirements. By leveraging configurable settings, organizations can dynamically adjust how orders are prioritized during availability checks, ensuring that critical shipments or key customers receive preferential allocation when supply is limited.

Interactive Backorer Processing

  • User can manually change the strategy.

Business Process Scheduling (BPS)

  • Scheduling activities can be incorporated to enable comprehensive planning and management of timelines, allowing users to coordinate and optimize schedules effectively within the system.

Product Allocation Check (PAL)

  • A supply limit function enables users to define maximum available quantities, and configuration values can be conveniently uploaded directly from Excel files for efficient mass updates.

Supply Protection (SUP)

  • It is possible to set minimum supply limits.

Alternative Based Confirmation (ABC)

  • When product shortages occur, the system can automatically switch plants or substitute products based on pre-configured master data settings, ensuring that customer demands are fulfilled as efficiently as possible. This automated substitution functionality enhances flexibility and responsiveness by automatically identifying alternative supply sources or equivalent products, aligning with customer requirements even in the face of inventory constraints.

Dynamic third-party order processing

  • Triggering of third-party order processing (TPOP), where the requirement for ordered goods in a sales order are passed to a vendor (supplier) for direct shipment to the end customer.

ATP Analysis

  • First increment of an improved user experience when reviewing the availability check result in sales order processing:
  • SAP Fiori user experience (UX)
  • Cross-item overview on availability check result
  • Display confirmations including substitutes
  • Navigation to classic delivery proposal screen for non-subitem confirmations to allow proposal adjustments

Interactive ATP

  • With Review Availability Check Results (RACR), users have the ability to manually adjust the confirmed quantities as needed. This feature enables greater control and flexibility in managing order fulfillment, allowing adjustments to be made directly within the system based on changing supply conditions or operational requirements.

Supply creation-Based Confirmation (SBC)

  • In integration scenarios with PP-DS, support is provided for both Characteristics-Dependent Planning (CDP) and Support Block Planning within PP/DS, enabling sophisticated planning capabilities based on product characteristics and optimized scheduling through block planning methods.

Release for delivery (RefDy)

  • It is possible to manually adjust the allocated confirmed quantity during the creation of delivery documents, providing additional flexibility in the shipping process.

Advanced ATP Online help:

ATP Functionalities

Product Availability Check

  • Basic Product Availability check
  • Manually selection product
  • Manually plant selection changing
  • Simple transportation and shipment scheduling based on days (and hours)

Back Order Processing

  • Basic Backorder processing.
  • The available prioritization options are quite limited, restricted mainly to dates and shipping priority, and cannot be extended beyond these parameters.

ATP Online Help:

How to Choose

  • If your organization requires only the current feature set and stability, ATP may be sufficient. However, be aware that there will be no further feature enhancements.
  • If your organization needs advanced features and the flexibility to adapt to new threats, Advanced ATP is the recommended choice. Its ongoing development ensures access to the latest tools.
  • Consider your long-term strategy. For organizations aiming for future scalability and innovation, Advanced ATP will be more appropriate.
  • Advanced ATP requires an additional license beyond S/4HANA. Please contact your our sales guys about the detail.

Limitations

  • You cannot use ATP and Advanced ATP functionalities together. Selection of one platform means you rely exclusively on its feature set.
  • Migrating from ATP to Advanced ATP may require reconfiguration, so plan the transition carefully if you anticipate future needs for newer features.

Conclusion

When deciding between ATP and Advanced ATP, assess your organization’s future goals. If long-term growth and adaptability to new threats are priorities, Advanced ATP is the optimal selection. For static requirements with no need for new functionalities, ATP remains a viable, though limited, option. The inability to combine both platforms’ features underscores the importance of a clear, strategic choice.

 

Brought to you by the SAP S/4HANA Customer Care and RIG

entry.content:
Navigate to the Rule Group: Go to your consolidation environment and find the transaction for maintaining Rule Groups (e.g., often found under Consolidation Settings > Rules for Automatic Postings > Manage Rules for Automatic Postings > How to Define Rule Groups).

Select Your Rule Group: Find and open the Rule Group that contains your posting rule Z99.

Check the "Processing Mode" Field: In the Rule Group configuration, there will be a key field called Processing Mode or similar. This field must be set to YTD - Year to Date.

Save the Change: Save the updated Rule Group

entry.title: Taming the X12 856 message in SAP Integration Advisor: A Step-by-Step Guide
entry.content:
Introduction

In customer support we often get requests how to handle X12 856 (Ship Notice/Manifest) messages. In a previous blog post we explained how we can handle X12 856 messages as source messages with the help of pre-transformations. In this article we show the reverse scenario where the X12 856 message is the target message. The biggest challenge there is the correct ordering of the HL segments according to the packaging hierarchy and the determination of their hierarchical ID numbers. Currently, this can only done with a custom post-processing XSLT script which is explained in details.

Scenario

We use the reverse scenario of our earlier blog post: Assume you have a source MIG based on a cXML ShipNoticeRequest which shall be mapped to an X12 856 based target MIG. Let's start with the source MIG:

Structure of source MIG (cXML ShipNoticeRequest)

There is not so much to mention. The important parts for our scenario are the ShipNoticePortion group, which corresponds to the orders, the ShipNoticeItem group, which contains the line items of the shipment, and the Packaging group, which describes the packing for each item. These are the parts which needs to be mapped to the different hierarchy levels of the HL segments in the target X12 856 message, which looks like the following:

Structure of target MIG (cXML ShipNoticeRequest)

Note that we used here Integration Advisor's qualification feature to distinguish the different hierarchy levels: We have in total four duplications of the HL segment, each is qualified by a different value of element 735 (Hierarchical Level Code): S for shipment (corresponds to the root of the source cXML message), O for order (corresponds to the ShipNoticePortion of the source), P for pack (corresponds to Package), and I for item (corresponds to ShipNoticeItem). But if we exactly do these mappings:

  • ShipNoticeRequest -> HL[S]
  • ShipNoticePortion -> HL[O]
  • Package -> HL[P]
  • ShipNoticeItem -> HL[I],

First naive mapping attempt

and simulate it with the attached payload, we see the following issues in the resulting payload:

  1. The hierarchical ID number (field 628) is missing.
  2. the parent hierarchical ID number (field 734) is missing.
  3. The HL groups are sorted according to their type and not according to their hierarchical order.
  4. The packages are duplicated, we see four instances of them, although the source cXML message contains only three of them:

Actual payload after naive mapping

The expected payload should look something like this:

Expected target payload

Here each child element is below its corresponding parent element, has a unique continuous number, and a reference to its parent.

Solution

This mapping challenge unfortunately can't solved with Integration Advisor's core capabilities, however, it's still possible to use Integration Advisor for the main mapping and use an additional XSLT script to generate the expected output. But before we explain the XSLT script, we need to add some additional mappings to the naive mapping explained above so that the XSLT script can do its work:

      • Create a group-to-leaf mapping (see also Group to Leaf Mapping)  from ShipNoticePortion to HL[735=O]/HL/628 with the following XSLT function:
<xsl:sequence select="$nodes_in/ShipNoticePortion/@position"/>

Note: This is not the final content of the 628 field, but serves as a temporary ID to distinguish the different orders (ShipNoticePortions) in the intermediate result. You could also use other unique IDs of the order like the orderID. Here the ID is just the position of the order in the list of all ShipNoticePortions.

      • Create another group-to-leaf mapping from ShipNoticePortion to HL[735=P]/HL/734 with the same XSLT function:
<xsl:sequence select="$nodes_in/ShipNoticePortion/@position"/>​

If you used another ID in step 1 you have to use the same here as well. Please note that this mapping line goes to one level deeper than the first one (to HL[735=P] instead to HL[735=O]. And the target node is 734 instead of 628.

      • Create a mapping from ShipNoticePortion/ShipNoticeItem/Packaging/ShippingContainerSerialCode to HL[735=P]/HL/628. Like in step 1 this is needed to uniquely identify the packages and is only a temporary ID, which later will be replaced by the final value.
      • Map the same field (ShipNoticePortion/ShipNoticeItem/Packaging/ShippingContainerSerialCode) also to HL[735=I]/HL/734 (again one level deeper and a different target field).
      • And finally map the nodes ShipNoticePortion/OrderReference/orderID and ShipNoticePortion/ShipNoticeItem/lineNumber to HL[735=I]/HL/628. Again we need a unique ID for each item, which is the concatenation of orderID and lineNumber in this case. Again also other alternatives are possible.

These mapping lines are only those relevant for the construction of the right target structure. Obviously you need to add the mapping lines for the right content, which is omitted here to reduce the complexity.

With these mappings we get a target payload like the previous one, but with the small difference that each hierarchy item now has an identifier, which could be used in a post-processing XSLT script to sort them according to their hierarchy as well as to eliminate duplicates, and a reference to its parent item:

Target payload after IA mapping

Here we show the XML version of the target payload, because that is what is created by the XSLT mapping generated by the Integration Advisor. Although it's possible to download the flat file version in Integration Advisor, the final conversion from XSLT to flat file is done by the corresponding EDI flowstep of Cloud Integration. And that's why we can use an additional XSLT step in our Cloud Integration pipeline (or in the custom post-processing Integration Flow, if you use TPM) to transform it to the right structure. 

This can be done with the attached XSLT (note, that you have to change the namespace prefix of the root node to xsl to make it work, due to some security restrictions, I couldn't upload the correct file). If you apply it to the previous result you get this XML:

As you can see the different hierarchy levels are in the right order, each children is under its corresponding parent and has a continuous number, and also the duplicate is eliminated. Furthermore, each element has the right reference to its parent in the D_734 field. If you convert it to an EDI flat file, you will get exactly the payload shown at the beginning of this article.

Note also that the script can be applied to the IA version of the payload as well as to the Cloud Integration version. If you use an Integration Flow like this, this means that you can add it before or after the "X12 Post-processing" step. It will work in the same way in both cases. If you use TPM, the optional post-processing in the interchange step (see point 37 in Trading Partner Agreement and Understanding the ProcessDirect Adapter) always works on the Cloud Integration version of the payload. But also there the XSLT script is usable. You need to build an Integration Flow with a ProcessDirect Adapter as inbound channel. This Integration Flow needs only one XSLT mapping step which uses the XSLT script.

Conclusion

With the attached XSLT script you can now create a correct X12 856 message with Integration Advisor. It should work for most of the cases independent of the required hierarchy levels (and also some similar ones with small modifications). It neither depends on the exact source message, therefore it should be usable also for scenarios with other source messages. The only condition which needs to be fulfilled is that to each hierarchy item a unique identifier can be assigned which is mapped to the D_628 and D_734 fields as in our example. If you have similar scenarios for which this script does not work, let me know, maybe we can find a solution together. I would be happy to hear from you.

entry.title: Re: SAP Public Cloud Intrastat Conversion of Regions
entry.content:
Hello @DanailKamenov 

Thank you for your question. I hope this still provides some vital details.

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, the setup for Intrastat reporting is streamlined compared to on-premise. Some customizing options like defining separate “administrative regions” and mapping them to general regions are not available in CBC.

Here are some key points for Public Cloud I suggest to take note of:

  1. For designated regions: Only the delivered general regions from business partner / address master data are used in Intrastat reporting. There is no separate customizing for Intrastat administrative regions in Public Cloud unlike on-premise.
  2. When using Intrastat Reporting Apps: The apps Prepare Intrastat Declaration, Dispatches (F4851) and Arrivals (F4850) take the region of destination or origin from the address data. These apps expect the official region codes in the format required by the local legislation.
  3. How to handle your case (3-letter codes vs. 2-digit codes): Since you cannot create a mapping layer in Public Cloud, the region codes in the Business Partner address master data must directly match the Intrastat reporting requirement (three-letter codes in your case). Existing general regions with two-digit codes cannot be deleted, but they also do not need to be used. You can maintain the correct 3-letter codes as additional region entries and assign them to the relevant business partner addresses.
  4. SAP recommends; not to create new “administrative regions” like in on-premise; instead, define the required general regions with the correct codes for reporting. Leave the old 2-digit entries unused (they remain in the system but have no effect if not assigned to master data).

 

These references will provide further guidance:

Prepare Intrastat Declaration

Business Partner Address Data – Regions

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Quality Heat Number Flow in Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi Raj,

in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, this type of requirement is possible but needs to follow the extensibility framework. Below you will find steps to guide you:

  1. Where you can capture the value
  • In Usage Decision, you can add a Custom Field via Custom Fields and Logic app.
  • Business Context: Inspection Lot Usage Decision (or related QM contexts).
  • This allows the user to record the “Quality Heat Number” during usage decision.
  1. How you can make the field flow to stock apps
  • The Multiple Stock app and Stock Single Material (which has replaced MMBE) only display fields available in material document or stock tables.
  • To pass your custom value into these stock apps, you must:
    • Ensure you extend the relevant Business Context in Inventory Management (e.g. Material Document Item).
    • Make use of Custom Logic to transfer the value from QM into the material document posting that updates stock.
  • This way, your “Quality Heat Number” becomes part of stock characteristics.
  1. There are also some alternative approaches
  • If you only need this for reporting, it might be easier to:
    • Store the Heat Number in the inspection lot or usage decision.
    • Create a Custom CDS View joining Inspection Lot plus Material Document plus Stock.
    • Expose this in a custom report or KPI app in Fiori.
  • This will avoid trying to modify standard stock apps and keeps your solution upgrade-stable.
  1. Please note the limitations in Public Cloud
  • You cannot directly inject custom fields into all standard stock apps like Display Stock Multiple Materials.
  • Instead, use Custom Fields (Inventory Mgmt. context) plus Custom Logic for mapping plus Custom Analytical Reports if display in MMBE-like apps is not supported.

The following references will provide further support:

Extensibility in SAP S/4HANA Cloud

Business Contexts for Custom Fields

Material Document Item  Custom Field Extensibility

I hope this provides the right guidance.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Integration of Work instructions from S4-Public to SA...
entry.content:
Hi @RodoFK 

Thank you for your question. we apologise for the delayed response and hope the following details will provide some help.

In S/4HANA Public Cloud, the way you handle work instructions for SAP Digital Manufacturing is different compared to ERP/on-premise, where PRT-type documents could be directly used.

Here are some key differences vs. on-premise

  • In ERP/on-premise, Production Resource/Tool type = “Document” was commonly used to attach work instructions to routing/operation.
  • In S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, PRTs of type “Document” are not available. Instead, the supported way is to use Document Management System (DMS) integrated with routings/operations.

Here is how you can include work instructions in Public Cloud

  1. Firstly, upload Work Instructions as Documents
    • Use the app Manage Documents in S/4HANA Cloud.
    • Store your work instruction for example PDF, Word, image in the DMS.
  2. Then, assign Document to Master Data
    • Assign the document to the operation in the routing or production version using the Manage Routings or Process Routings app.
    • This replaces the on-premise PRT-document approach.
  3. Integration with SAP Digital Manufacturing
    • When the production order is sent to SAP Digital Manufacturing, the document reference (work instruction) attached at operation level is transferred.
    • In SAP DM, the work instruction is then available for operators in Pod Work Instruction Viewer.

The following references provide further details

Integration of S/4HANA Cloud with SAP Digital Manufacturing Work Instructions

Manage Documents App

Assigning Documents to Routings/Operations in S/4HANA Cloud

 

I hope this provides the right guidance.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Behaviour in SAP Cloud ALM Test Execution Analytics
entry.content:
Hello,

This is indeed a bit of an unexpected behavior that confused me also the first time I used it. I think intuitively one would expect that from the moment we are using Test Plans, only Test Cases belonging to a Test Plan would be considered for execution. On the other hand, I can also imagine someone wondering why one of the Test Cases disappeared and was not tested, if we forget to add one of the Test Cases to a Test Plan.

It's a bit of a difficult design decision, especially when trying to make things as flexible as possible, but I would suggest maybe a checkbox option for a project, to decide between Test Plans being mandatory or not, if the checkbox is activated, only Test Cases included in a Test Plan would be considered for execution and show up. Also a warning if some Test Cases were forgotten would make sense maybe.

Cheers!

entry.title: Re: Create a valuation grouping
entry.content:
Hello @Santiago_Barrero 

Thank you for your question.  We apologise for the delayed response. 

SSCUI for Valuation Grouping

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, valuation grouping is maintained through SSCUI 102353 Define Valuation Control.

  • Here you can activate valuation grouping and assign valuation areas (plants) to valuation grouping codes.
  • Valuation grouping codes like 0001, 0002 are then used in automatic account determination.

SSCUIs for Automatic Account Determination

After defining the valuation grouping, you need to maintain the account determination customizing:

  • SSCUI 100297 Configure Automatic Postings (MM)
    • This is where you assign G/L accounts for transactions for example BSX, WRX, GBB based on chart of accounts, valuation grouping code, and account grouping.
  • SSCUI 100374 Define Account Grouping for Movement Types if additional groupings are needed.

Here are steps to Perform

  1. Go to SSCUI 102353 Define Valuation Control
    • Create/activate valuation grouping code .
    • Assign your valuation area (plant or company code) to this code.
  2. Go to SSCUI 100297, Configure Automatic Postings
    • Maintain the G/L account determination for your new valuation grouping code (0002).
  3. Optionally, you can check movement type groupings via SSCUI 100374 if you need different account grouping keys.

Here are references for more details:

Automatic Account Determination in S/4HANA Cloud

SSCUI 100297 – Configure Automatic Postings

I hope this provides the right guidance.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model: What’s New as of 2025-09-01?
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community members!

We’re excited to share the latest updates in SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud (SAP PaPM Cloud) Standard Model. This release introduces new roles, enhanced data management capabilities, and flexible feature toggling to improve your modeling and administrative experience.

 

I. Modeling Screen

We are introducing a new role in the SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud – Standard Model for the modeling screen called MODELING_RUN. Similarly with MODELING_READ role, the users with MODELING_RUN will not be able to perform changes in the Modeling screen, but users with this role can activate and run functions and execution activity in the process template level in the Modeling.

Additionally, the users with the MODELING_RUN role can access the Data Management Screen to view data but cannot edit it. The available options include downloading data, working with Layout, and using the Settings section to display the technical fields or toggle Pivot mode on and off.

To use this role, you need to update the instance in BTP with the new JSON code that contains the new role. You can find more information on how to perform this action on the Service Instance - Sample JSON File

After this, the MODELING_RUN role will be available in the Roles tab. Now you can create a role collection and assign it later to a designated use.

For more information, you may check the Role Templates in Standard Model.

 

II. Administration | Settings Screen

Let me walk you through the new section in the Settings screen, the Optional Features Settings! The Optional Features Settings gives administrators a way to activate or deactivate optional features of tenant for the users to explore the new features early in a certain period before the optional features are released globally.

Administrators will be notified through an in-app banner, which will include information about the new feature and a link to the SAP Community blog post, where they can read the published articles about the new features.

 To activate an optional feature:

  1. Go to the Menu > Administration > Settings screen via:
    1. Home page information banner link
    2. Menu > Administration > Settings
  2. Scroll down to Optional Features Settings section, click the toggle button for the feature you want to activate.
  3. Choose Save.

After successfully activating an optional feature/s, all users will receive a notification banner regarding the new available feature/s on their home page, including the SAP Community blog post link. Users can now explore the new activated feature.

Note: To view additional information about the feature, hover the cursor over the info tooltip.

In any case that administrators would want to switch back to the old features, we also have the option to deactivate the optional feature temporarily. At this moment, administrators will also have the chance to provide feedback on the feature.

To deactivate an optional feature:

  1. Go to the Settings screen via Menu > Administration > Settings.
  2. Under Optional Features Settings section, click on the toggle button of the feature you want to deactivate.
  3. After toggling, the system displays a feedback prompt. Choose either Submit Feedback or Skip Feedback to continue.
  4. Choose Save to apply your changes.

Once an optional feature is globally released, it will be automatically removed from the Settings screen.

Note: If no optional features are currently available, administrators will see the following message in the Settings screen

 

III. In-App Notification

There is a new notification method in SAP PaPM Cloud SM, this time it can be found in application level where users will also be notified apart from the email notifications that Performer and Reviewer teams are getting when Submitting, Approving or Submitting, and Initializing an activity or process. This In-App notification can be enabled via:

  1. Menu
  2. User Preferences
  3. Enable or Disable ‘Push Notifications’

After this switch is enabled, users part of Performer or Reviewer will now be notified via the bell icon on the upper-right side of the application.

For more information visit: Notification Settings

 

IV. Environment Screen (main) and Content Management

Another exciting addition in SAP PaPM Cloud SM application is the extended environment access level security which can now be maximized when creating, editing, and copying an environment in Environment Screen and Import any environment in Content Management.

For details you can read the blogpost SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model: Extended Environment Access Level Functionality.

 

V. Managing Default Data Representation (Modeling and Process Management screens)

SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud Standard Model modelers and process users can now conveniently set a default data representation or view in their input/output activities in Process Templates and Process Instances so they can immediately see the default view upon viewing input/output data.

To set the default data representation in Modeling and Process Management screens:

  1. In your modeling area, go to your existing Process Template > Input/Output Activity.
  2. In the General properties, scroll down to Default Data Representation section.
  3. Click on the dropdown and select an option:
    1. Pivot Off – If this is chosen, the data will be presented in Pivot Off view by default in Show screen.
    2. Pivot On – If this is chosen, the data will be presented in Pivot On view by default in Show screen.

       

  4. Choose Save to apply the changes.
  5. Choose the Manage Data button to view data.

To set the default data representation in Process Management screen:

  1. In the Process Management screen, go to your existing Process Instance > Input/Output Activity.
  2. In the General properties, scroll down to Default Data Representation section.
  3. Click on the dropdown and select an option:
    1. Pivot Off – If this is chosen, the data will be presented in Pivot Off view by default in Show screen.
    2. Pivot On – If this is chosen, the data will be presented in Pivot On view by default in Show screen.

       

  4. Choose Save to apply the changes.
  5. Choose the Manage Data button to view data.

Note: The default data representation defined from Process Template level will be reflected in the Process Instance input/output activity which can still be updated in the Process Instance level. 

 

VI. Data Management screen 

With the newest update, download options in Pivot ON of Data Management screen have been enhanced. Along with the visible dataset, you can now download the complete dataset, giving you full access to all the data in just one click. The dataset can also be exported in any file format that has been defined in the Modeling screen, giving you full flexibility.

Steps to download the complete dataset:

  1. Open the Data Management screen
  2. Enable Pivot mode
  3. Click the Download button in the header
  4. In the Data Download window, select Complete dataset
  5. (Optional) Choose the desired file format (as defined in Modeling screen)
  6. Click Download for the preferred XLSX or CSV format

Thank you for reading this blog post! We hope these new features enhance your experience with SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model. To explore previous updates, check out the tag PaPMCloudWhatsNew. Stay tuned for future What's New posts!

entry.title: 🟣 Roles and Authorization in SAP Build Process Automation: A Developer’s Guide
entry.content:
Effective access control is essential for secure and scalable process automation. This session provides a practical understanding of roles and authorization in SAP Build Process Automation. We’ll explore how pre-delivered role collections can be applied effectively, how shared environments enable granular control over runtime artifacts and API access, and how project-level authorization secures design-time assets. Together these elements form a cohesive and scalable authorization model that supports secure process automation development in SAP BTP. Attendees will leave with insights to implement robust access control in their own automation projects.

Speaker

  • Seshadri

Seshadri is the Lead Product Manager of SAP Build Process Automation and an SAP PRESS author. With over 18 years of service at SAP, he brings a wealth of experience in business process management & business rule management domain to his role. A seasoned speaker at conferences like TechEd, Sapphire, and bpmNext, Seshadri is known for his insights on process automation and digital transformation.
